The most important building. If your opponent captures your Capital, then you lose.
Allows you to build land units.
Allows you to build water units.
Allows you to build air units.

There are four types of buildings: Capitals, Factories, Ports, and Airports

The Capital is the most important building, because if your opponent captures your Capital, then you will lose the game.
Factories allow you to build land units.
Ports allow you to build water units.
Airports allow you to build air units.

The objective of the game is to capture your opponent's Capital.

Players take turns moving their units, attacking enemy units, capturing buildings, and building new units.

Unit information is located in each of the four corners of a cell containing a unit. The top-left corner contains the unit's movement range. The top-right corner contains the unit's attack range. The bottom-left corner contains the unit's attack power. The bottom-right corner contains the unit's current health.

Pressing a cell selects that cell. You can move your units by selecting a cell containing one of your units and then pressing an empty cell within the unit's movement range. You can attack enemy units by selecting a cell containing one of your units and then pressing a cell containing an enemy unit within your unit's attack range. You can capture a building if one of your units occupies the same cell as the building by double tapping the cell. You can end your turn using the action bar.

There are three types of levels that you can level up: Strength, Vitality, and Mobility. 

Strength increases the amount of damage your units do. Each Strength level increases the damage of your units by 5. 

Vitality increases the health of your units. Each Vitality level increases the health of your units by 5.

Mobility increases the maximum movement range of your units. Every 5 levels in Mobility increases the maximum movement range of your units by 1 square.
